alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 24 at 1:49AM CDT until September 24 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Benton County in northwestern Arkansas... Carroll County in northwestern Arkansas... Northwestern Madison County in northwestern Arkansas... Northeastern Washington County in northwestern Arkansas... * Until 500 AM CDT. * At 149 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Berryville... Eureka Springs... Bella Vista... Lowell... Pea Ridge... Holiday Island... Gentry... Green Forest... Tontitown... Gravette... Cave Springs... Decatur... Highfill... Gateway... Beaver... Springtown... War Eagle... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
